critique: The document is an order to exempt Arthur A. Quinn from compulsory retirement. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is probably a sense of stability and confidence in his leadership. The language is formal and authoritative, suggesting a desire to project competence and control. There is not enough information to suggest any strong emotions. The document is very specific and does not contain language that would strongly suggest joy, sadness, anger, fear, disgust, or surprise.
